thomson_scattering/midplane.documentation: Choice of midplane definition for the mapping of measurements on an equilibrium. Indicate the IMAS URI of the used equilibrium IDS in the ids_properties/provenance section.

thomson_scattering/midplane/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

thomson_scattering/channel/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device)

thomson_scattering/channel/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”

thomson_scattering/channel/line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

thomson_scattering/channel/polychromator.documentation: Index of the polychromator used by this channel (refers to the ../../polychromator array)

thomson_scattering/channel/scattering_an.documentation: Angle formed by the laser beam wave vector and the line of sight, counted clockwise when projected in the poloidal plane

thomson_scattering/channel/width_z.documentation: Full width of the light collection area along the Z coordinate

thomson_scattering/channel/solid_angle.documentation: Solid angle of the line of sight

thomson_scattering/channel/position.documentation: Average position of the measurements (intersection between laser beam and line of sight)

thomson_scattering/channel/position/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

thomson_scattering/channel/delta_positio.documentation: Incremental variation of the position of the measurements, due to e.g. different lasers not intersecting the line of sight at the same position. The actual position is then the static position + delta_position

thomson_scattering/channel/position_per_.documentation: Position of the intersection between each laser beam and this line of sight
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

thomson_scattering/channel/distance_sepa.documentation: Distance between the measurement position and the separatrix, mapped along flux surfaces to the outboard midplane, in the major radius direction. Positive value means the measurement is outside of the separatrix.

thomson_scattering/channel/t_e/validity_.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

thomson_scattering/channel/t_e/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

thomson_scattering/channel/n_e/validity_.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

thomson_scattering/channel/n_e/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity)

thomson_scattering/channel/gaussian_fit.documentation: Amplitude of the gaussian fit of the measured signal in each energy band, used to estimate the electron temperature

thomson_scattering/laser/energy_in.documentation: Energy of the laser pulse measured just before entering the vacuum vessel

thomson_scattering/laser/energy_out.documentation: Energy of the laser pulse measured after crossing the plasma

thomson_scattering/polychromator/wavelen.documentation: Set of wavelength bands in which photons are counted by the polychromator
Lower bound of the detector wavelength range
Upper bound of the detector wavelength range
Probability of detection of a photon impacting the detector as a function of its wavelength

thomson_scattering/polychromator/calibra.documentation: Factor to be multiplied by the spectral calibration to obtain the instrument function (fraction of signal received on each energy channel when a photon of relevant energy enters the optical system)
Date at which the absolute calibration was carried out
Polychromator response function: fraction of signal received on each energy channel when a photon of relevant energy enters the polychromator.
Date at which the spectral calibration was carried out

thomson_scattering/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.
